failure.message:
cy.request() failed on:
https://thy.test.l7informatics.com/login
The response we received from your web server was:
> 401: Unauthorized
This was considered a failure because the status code was not '2xx' or '3xx'.
If you do not want status codes to cause failures pass the option: 'failOnStatusCode: false'
-----------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------
The response we got was:
Status: 401 - Unauthorized Headers: { "content-length": "57", "content-type": "application/json; charset=UTF-8", "access-control-allow-origin": "*, *", "expires": "0", "access-control-allow-methods": "GET, PUT, POST, DELETE, OPTIONS", "access-control-allow-headers": "access-control-allow-origin,authorization,content-type", "cache-control": "no-cache, no-store", "access-control-allow-credentials": "true", "login-url": "/login", "server-execution-time-ms": "696.3241100311279", "vary": "Accept-Encoding", "server": "Lab7_ESP/2.3.x.1.20200625232458", "pragma": "no-cache", "date": "Mon, 29 Jun 2020 15:10:38 GMT", "session-token-expires-minutes": "120", "x-server": "server_8005", "x-frame-options": "sameorigin", "x-content-type-options": "nosniff", "x-xss-protection": "1; mode=block", "set-cookie": [ "l7_esp_server_id=; Expires=Thu, 01-Jan-1970 00:00:01 GMT; path=/" ] } Body: { "error": "A user with those credentials was not found." }
